thread.title: Throw 'luck of the draw' out the window
thread.title_full: Throw 'luck of the draw' out the window

title: Throw 'luck of the draw' out the window
text:
Throw 'luck of the draw' out the window Jesus Jimenez , jjimenez@richmond.gannett.com 7:14 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Buy Photo Centerville's Reese VanDevender looks to advance the ball against Northeastern during a football game Friday, Sept. 25, 2015, in Fountain City. (Photo: Joshua Smith/Palladium-Item) Buy Photo 5 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
As up and down as Centerville's football season has been, the Bulldogs enter Friday's sectional tournament with optimism. 
As the 0-9 Bulldogs visit the 0-9 Switzerland County Pacers, Centerville has an opportunity to play at least a week longer than half the state of Indiana. 
At the other extreme, the Tri-Eastern Conference champion Northeastern Knights (7-2, 7-0) travel to their nemesis, the Class 2A state-ranked and undefeated Eastern Hancock Royals (9-0) that have topped the Knights in back-to-back sectional championship meetings, and could mean an early exit for the TEC's top team. 
Or, neither of those could happen. 
The luck of the draw only means so much as teams open IHSAA sectional tournament play Friday night. 
“We can’t overlook these guys because we’re kind of in the same shape they are,” Centerville coach Perry Irwin said. “For our young kids to have some tournament success this early in their career, … It’d mean the world to us to be honest with you.” 
Three of the teams in the TEC play in Class 2A Sectional 38, with Northeastern and Eastern Hancock entering postseason play with the two best records. 
Eastern Hancock is ranked second in the final Associated Press state poll and fifth in the coaches poll while Northeastern is 14th in the AP poll. 
The Royals beat Northeastern 33-7 in Week 1, as well as 21-20 in last year's sectional final and 57-36 in the 2013 sectional final. Both teams finished the regular season with shutout victories and both teams have two shutouts this year. 
“It’s certainly an opportunity and that’s how we’re going to look at it,” said Northeastern coach Mike Roeder, who is seeking his 97th career head-coaching victory. 
The winner advances to play the winner of the Milan at Indianapolis Howe game while the Centerville-Switzerland County winner would face the Union County at Triton Central winner. 
Class A Sectional 46 also features three TEC teams with Hagerstown (5-4) traveling to Tri (2-7) with the winner advancing to meet the Indianapolis Shortridge (2-6) at Lincoln (3-6) winner. In the other bracket, Indianapolis Lutheran (5-4) visits Knightstown (2-7) and Tindley (1-5) travels to Indiana Deaf (7-2). 
In Class A Sectional 44, Union City (4-5) hosts Southern Wells (6-3), with the winner meeting the Adams Central (8-1) at Wes-Del (4-5) winner. 
Shenandoah (7-2) plays at Tri-Central (9-0) with the winner meeting the Anderson Prep (3-6) at Monroe Central (7-2) winner. 
In Class 2A Sectional 36, Alexandria (3-6) is at Eastbrook (9-0), Blackford (0-9) is at Taylor (3-6), Madison-Grant (2-7) is at Elwood (5-4) and Winchester (7-2) is at Eastern (Greentown) (3-6). 
Winchester seeks to advance to a second straight sectional championship game. 
“At this point, you just have to let the chips fall where they will,” Winchester coach Mike Jones said. “… All of these guys are in our region. It gives us an opportunity to showcase our kids and give them a chance to play in the North-South All-Star game." 
IHSAA Sectionals Game 1: Southern Wells (6-3) at Union City (4-5) Game 2: Adams Central (8-1) at Wes-Del (4-5) Game 3: Shenandoah (7-2) at Tri-Central (9-0) Game 4: Anderson Prep Academy (3-6) at Monroe Central (7-2) 
Class A Sectional 46 Game 1: Hagerstown (5-4) at Tri (2-7) Game 2: Indianapolis Shortridge (2-6) at Lincoln (3-6) Game 3: Indianapolis Lutheran (5-4) at Knightstown (2-7) Game 4: Tindley (1-5) at Indiana Deaf (7-2) 
Class 2A Sectional 36 Game 1: Alexandria (3-6) at Eastbrook (9-0) Game 2: Blackford (0-9) at Taylor (3-6) Game 3: Madison-Grant (2-7) at Elwood (5-4) Game 4: Winchester (7-2) at Eastern (Greentown) (3-6) 
Class 2A Sectional 38 Game 1: Union County (3-6) at Triton-Central (5-4) Game 2: Centerville (0-9) at Switzerland County (0-9) Game 3: Northeastern (7-2) at Eastern Hancock (9-0) Game 4: Milan (4-5) at Indianapolis Howe (6-3) 5 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://pinews.co/1LJkF47 TOP VIDEOS
